Mircea Iurcu
Product Designer at @Avira. Passionate about Front-End, Star Wars, football, coffee and Guinness.
Jan 16, 2016

A year of great work experience

2015 was a year when I learned a lot of things, I got a lot of opportunities and supportive people around and looking back I am very thankful to everyone.

Post ioteo era

At the end of 2014, just right before December, just right before what could be an awesome Christmas Party, the start-up where I’ve worked had some troubles and I found myself with plenty of time to enjoy on the holidays. I wasn’t so worried about the situation and having more free time was a great opportunity to work on my portfolio and website, so I’ve set up a new clean WordPress on my computer and tried some themes, tweaking them, didn’t like it, started from scratch and eventually 2015 came, with couple of interviews and some freelancing projects, just enough to leave my website redesign.

Short about freelancing and remote working

It is great. You have a lot of time playing and watching movies, because you are productive from 1AM…

Hubgets and 4PSA

At the end of February I joined 4PSA, and started working on Hubgets (it’s a cool thing, you should check it). It was definitely a bigger company that I am used to, and was a little bit anxious at the beginning, but still they have a start-up atmosphere and culture. At 4PSA I was doing literally Web Design, I know, I know, no one uses this term anymore, let’s say that I was a Full Stack Designer. It was quite interesting working there and was a great experience for me, even if I stayed only for a little over 5 months, their company culture is one that makes you go everyday at work and I tried to engage everyone in fun activities, this is something they should work on and make a their place less stressed and concentrated on delivering code and releasing features.

A new start at Avira

In August I started a new challenge for me and joined as a Product Designer at Avira, an even bigger company and was even more stressed about how to work on a multi-cultural and multi-national environment, but in short time I found some great people from whom I could learn more and who can share their experience. Working for a security software company you don’t have the privilege to design many beautiful and shiny things, but often you get more satisfaction from the fact that products that you are designing are helping a lot of people and keep them protected.

Achievements unlocked in 2015

This year I’ve visited 3 countries, I played a lot, maybe more than I should, finished GTA V and Max Payne 3. Yeay!… I also discovered the most awesome show - “True Detective” or at the same level with Game of Thrones. I also have grown my beard for three times, for every professional change that happened for me in 2015.

2016 Resolutions?!

I don’t quite qualify as a person that goes for some fixed New Year Resolutions, it is better to do the things one at a time or to develop new habits, but still I would like to continue going at football and basketball, use more the bike and less the Uber and do more healthy things like not mixing beer with vodka... So here is my short list or AGR or OKR for 2016 :)

  • Read more, at least finish Game of Thrones books
  • Write more than only one article called “2015 Year in Review article”
  • Don’t only start, but finish some fun side-projects
  • Visit at least three new countries
  • Engage more with fellow designers
  • Do some fancy YouTube, Facebook or Wikpedia redesigns, everyone does.
